definition: To formally administer an oath or pledge, typically in a legal or official context, ensuring the commitment and truthfulness of an individual. This term is commonly employed in legal proceedings, courtrooms, or when appointing public officials.

examples.english: He was sworn in as a witness.
The president will be inaugurated tomorrow.

examples.german: Die Soldaten wurden vereidigt, um ihr Land zu verteidigen.
examples.english: The soldiers were sworn in to defend their country.

examples.german: Der Richter vereidigte den Zeugen vor Gericht.
examples.english: The judge swore in the witness in court.

examples.german: Der Polizist wurde vereidigt, um die Gesetze durchzusetzen.
examples.english: The police officer was sworn in to enforce the laws.
